channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anthropic revenue tied to two customers as AI pricing war threatens margins
item.description: Anthropic faces risks as $5B run rate leans on Cursor and GitHub Copilot as OpenAI’s cheaper GPT‑5 undercuts Claude, spotlighting customer concentrati...

item.title: Why investors are making a big mistake by not worrying more about tariffs
item.description: President Trump’s tariff fight no longer looks to be the biggest worry keeping investors up at night, according to a new BofA Global survey.

item.title: Trade Desk’s stock sees its worst drop ever, and analysts wonder if Amazon is to blame
item.description: Some say newfound competition is pressuring Trade Desk’s growth, but the ad-tech company’s CEO brushed off the Amazon threat.

item.title: Black Hat 2025: Why your AI tools are becoming the next insider threat
item.description: Black Hat 2025 delivered performance metrics from beta programs and agentic AI deployments, proving results are being delivered over hype.

item.title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 rollout is not going smoothly
item.description: It also failed on a simple algebra arithmetic problem that elementary schoolers could probably nail, 5.9 = x + 5.11.

item.title: Gold and bitcoin are both vying to be safe havens for investors. Why gold is winning so far this year.
item.description: There has been no shortage of investor jitters in 2025, and gold is showing no sign of ceding its crown as the go-to safe haven.

item.title: ShengShu Technology launches Vidar multi-view physical AI training model
item.description: ShengShu says its Vidar embodied AI model combines physical data and simulated video for a more scalable path to training real-world robots. The post ...

item.title: Unitree launches A2 quadruped equipped with front and rear lidar
item.description: Unitree said its latest A2 quadruped robot can tackle more rugged terrain with greater perception capabilities than its previous robots. The post Unit...

item.title: ‘This scam stuff is going to get worse’: A man approached me in my car — he had a crazy story
item.description: “I got rid of him by asking for a business card and a company name, and he bugged out.”

item.title: ChatGPT users dismayed as OpenAI pulls popular models GPT-4o, o3 and more — enterprise API remains (for now)
item.description: OpenAI has announced GPT-5 will replace all models on ChatGPT. Many users are mourning the workhorse model.

item.title: Sweetgreen’s customers are cutting back on pricey salads. Will extra chicken help?
item.description: Sweetgreen’s stock is sliding toward its worst day on record, and the company says it’s boosting some portion sizes to enhance the value proposition.

item.title: Orbbec touts Pulsar ME450 as a multi-pattern 3D lidar
item.description: Orbbec says its Pulsar ME450 sensor can switch scanning modes so that robots don't need to switch between devices for navigation or 3D reconstruction....

item.title: OpenAI returns old models to ChatGPT as Sam Altman admits ‘bumpy’ GPT-5 rollout
item.description: The pressure is on for OpenAI to prove that GPT-5 isn’t just an incremental update, but a true step forward.

item.title: Amtenbrink deploys Teqram’s EasyGrinder to cut 1,500 parts a day
item.description: Amtenbrink said post-processing is a highly manual process involving four distinct steps with multiple handling operations. The post Amtenbrink deploy...

item.title: Can iRobot bounce back? Deep concerns overshadow $127M Q2
item.description: Things have gotten so bad that iRobot has suspended future financial guidance and opted not to host an earnings call for Q2. The post Can iRobot bounc...

item.description: At long last, OpenAI has released GPT-5. The new system abandons the distinction between OpenAI’s flagship models and its o series of reasoning models...
